What if I already have a test environment?

Let's use it! These instructions are intended to get you into a working environment where you can learn SaltStack without a lot of fiddling, but your own environment can be used instead.

Learning SaltStack is a hands-on experience. While you can get the hang of things by reading this guide, SaltStack is easy to set up and we've included several examples you can run to help you learn.

Complete these instructions to set up a simple test environment where you can install SaltStack.

  1. Install VirtualBox.
  2. Install Vagrant.
  3. Download the ss-demo zip and extract it to a folder on your system.
  4. Open a command prompt to the extracted folder: 
    cd ~/ss-demo
  5. Run vagrant up to start the demo environment: 
    vagrant up

While vagrant starts, ....

When Vagrant completes and you are back at the command prompt, click Next to get on with the installation.
